title: Lesson 2: Tools and Safety in the Woodworking Shop

questions.q: Which of the following is the MAIN cause of most accidents in the woodshop?
options: Dull tools
Not paying attention
Improper clothing
Using the wrong material

questions.q: When using a chisel, which of the following is the safest practice?
options: Strike the chisel with a hammer instead of a mallet
Always push the blade toward your body
Secure the wood with a clamp or vise
Hold the wood with your non-dominant hand
questions.answer: Secure the wood with a clamp or vise

questions.q: What should you ALWAYS wear when operating power tools?
options: Gloves
Ear protection
Eye protection
Dust mask

questions.q: The “12/3 Rule” in the woodshop refers to:
options: Cutting only wood 12 inches wide and 3 inches thick
Cutting only wood 12 inches long and 3 inches wide
Using machines only for 12 minutes with a 3-minute break
A 12-step, 3-rule safety guideline
questions.answer: Cutting only wood 12 inches long and 3 inches wide

questions.q: Why are SHARP tools considered safer than dull tools?
options: Sharp tools are heavier and easier to control
They require less pressure and are easier to control
They cut slower and give more reaction time
They prevent wood from splintering
questions.answer: They require less pressure and are easier to control
